intro: Sideroxylon adolfi-friederici subsp. keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan ironwood, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for construction and fuel. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences. This species is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
